Dictionary.description:
-- Definition -- The scheme used to assign a designation to the Protected Sites.
-- Description -- NOTE 1 Schemes may be internationally recognised (for example, Natura2000 or the Emerald Network schemes), or may be national schemes (for example, the designations used for nature conservation in a particular Member State).
NOTE 2 Typically, this code list will be extended with code schemes used within Member States.

Definition.description: -- Definition -- The Protected Site has a designation under either the Habitat Directive (92/43/EEC) or the Birds Directive (79/409/EEC).
Definition.name: natura2000

Definition.description:
-- Definition -- The Protected Site has a designation under the Emerald Network.
-- Description -- The Emerald Network is an ecological network to conserve wild flora and fauna and their natural habitats in Europe.
Definition.name: emeraldNetwork

Definition.description:
-- Definition -- The Protected Site has a designation under the Ramsar Convention.
-- Description -- The Ramsar Convention provides the framework for national action and international cooperation for the conservation and wise use of wetlands and their resources.
Definition.name: ramsar

Definition.description: -- Definition -- The Protected Site has a designation under UNESCO World Heritage Convention.
Definition.name: UNESCOWorldHeritage

Definition.description: -- Definition -- The Protected Site has a classification using the International Union for Conservation of Nature classification scheme.
Definition.name: IUCN

Definition.description: -- Definition -- The Protected Site has a designation under UNESCO Man and Biosphere programme.
Definition.name: UNESCOManAndBiosphereProgramme

Definition.description: -- Definition -- The Protected Site has a classification using the National Monuments Record classification scheme.
Definition.name: nationalMonumentsRecord
